title: Timeline Release Arbiter

dimensions.label: Architecture & Branching Model
dimensions.description: Clarity and practicality of the branch model and environment mapping.

bands.label: Vague
bands.criteria: Branch model is hand-wavy or inconsistent; environments are unclear. Lists some branches but not clear usage.

bands.label: Partial
bands.criteria: Defines a model but leaves gaps or contradictions. Environments mapped but rules fuzzy.

bands.label: Coherent
bands.criteria: Provides a concrete, enforceable branching strategy tied to environments. Clearly maps rules for creation, merging, and deletion.

dimensions.label: Release Workflow & Automation
dimensions.description: Quality of the release train, tagging, and automation story.

bands.label: Ad-hoc
bands.criteria: Releases are loosely defined; lots of manual steps. Tags missing or afterthought.

bands.label: Structured
bands.criteria: Has a reasonable workflow but light on automation or specifics. Mentions stabilization but not concrete gates.

bands.label: Deliberate
bands.criteria: Outlines a release workflow ready for CI/CD. Clear release branch/tag validation and finalization steps.

dimensions.label: Risk Management & Recovery
dimensions.description: How hotfixes, backports, and history rewrites are handled safely.

bands.label: Risky
bands.criteria: Hotfix/backport flows barely addressed. No defined procedure for history rewrites.

bands.label: Aware
bands.criteria: Acknowledges risks but leaves holes in recovery. Defines hotfix branch but not merge directions nicely.

bands.label: Resilient
bands.criteria: Clear flows for hotfixes/backports with merge directions. Explicit guidance on revert vs rebase.

dimensions.label: Collaboration & Auditability
dimensions.description: How well the design supports team collaboration, debugging, and learning from history.

bands.label: Opaque
bands.criteria: Little thought on commit conventions/tags. New team members would struggle.

bands.label: Readable
bands.criteria: Adds some conventions/notes but doesn't fully close the loop. Defines basic PR/commit practices.

bands.label: Auditable
bands.criteria: Design makes history a teaching tool and audit trail. Clear standards for commits, tags, and onboarding.

grade_bands.label: B
grade_bands.description: Functional but has gaps in safety or recovery.

autofail_conditions: Promoting history rewrites on shared branches without safety.
llm_judge_instructions: Evaluate the 'Release & History Blueprint' against the dimensions. Focus on the practicality for a team of 5-20 engineers. Be strict about specific branch names and merge rules.
